description: Borrowed from Late Latin dērogātōrius, from Latin dērogāre; corresponding to derogate +‎ -ory.

adjectives.description: derogatory (comparative more derogatory, superlative most derogatory)

entries.meaning: Reducing the power or value of (a governmental body, etc); detracting from.
examples: Acts of Parliament derogatory from the power of subsequent Parliaments bind not.

entries.meaning: Lessening the worth of (a person, etc); expressing derogation; insulting.
examples: Billie Jean King said Friday that the Australian Open’s Margaret Court Arena should have its name changed because of Court’s derogatory comments about gay and transgender people.

entries.meaning: (law, of a clause in a testament) Being or pertaining to a derogatory clause.
A trade-line on a credit report that includes negative credit history.
